qas.question: The Luftwaffe air fleets were taking what kind of losses?
What did the punishing losses to the air fleet cause the Luftwaffe to do?
What kind of strategy did the Luftwaffe use to give their bombers better protection?
What city did Hitler give a speech where he said he would erase British cities?
In what year did Hitler give the speech at Sportspalast?

context: Regardless of the ability of the Luftwaffe to win air superiority, Adolf Hitler was frustrated that it was not happening quickly enough. With no sign of the RAF weakening, and Luftwaffe air fleets (Luftflotten) taking <a0_0>punishing<a0_0/> losses, the OKL was keen for a <a1_0>change in strategy<a1_0/>. To reduce losses further, a change in strategy was also favoured to take place at night, to give the bombers greater protection under <a2_0>cover of darkness<a2_0/>.[b] On 4 September <a4_0>1940<a4_0/>, in a long address at the <a3_0>Sportspalast<a3_0/>, Hitler declared: "And should the Royal Air Force drop two thousand, or three thousand [kilograms ...] then we will now drop [...] 300,000, 400,000, yes one million kilograms in a single night. And should they declare they will greatly increase their attacks on our cities, then we will erase their cities."
